sentences.en: " All right, " with a sigh and reluctantly.
sentences.cn: “ 好吧. ” 萨利不甘心地叹了一口气.

sentences.en: " Reluctantly, I strapped on the accordion and played some simple songs.
sentences.cn: 我勉强套上琴的背带,拉了一些简单的歌曲.
“ 十三街, "嘉莉很不情愿地说, " 西一百一十二号. ”

sentences.en: After that, reluctantly at first, he began exercising himself regularly.
sentences.cn: 在此以后, 他开始定期做操, 不过起先有些勉强.

sentences.en: Finally he strode home reluctantly, with his poor head full of visions.
sentences.cn: 后来他终于极不情愿地朝家走去, 他那可怜的脑瓜子里充满了各种各样的幻想.

sentences.en: He finally agreed, albeit reluctantly, to help us.
sentences.cn: 尽管勉强，他最后还是同意帮助我们。

sentences.en: He finds politics a dirty game, and only enters them reluctantly because he knows that at the very least he and his friends are better than the present gang.
sentences.cn: 他发现政治是一种肮脏的把戏, 所以只是出于不得已才参与政治,这是因为他知道,最起码他和自己的朋友们比这帮人要强得多.

sentences.en: He parted with the foreigners reluctantly and thanked for their " donations. "
sentences.cn: 他依依惜别,感谢司大人、贝大人的 “ 布施 ”.

sentences.en: He reluctantly conceded that he was not fit enough to play in the match.
sentences.cn: 他不情愿地承认自己的状态不足以应付这场比赛.

sentences.en: He thought for a moment, then reluctantly agreed.
sentences.cn: 他思量了一下, 才勉强同意了.

sentences.en: I heard the sound of a bolt being slowly and reluctantly slid open.
sentences.cn: 我听到门闩被缓慢而吃力地拉开的声音。

sentences.en: She reluctantly came to the conclusion that Bessie was drunk.
sentences.cn: 但哈丽特却着实吓了一跳,她不得不认定贝西是喝醉了.
她不愿把真实情况讲出来.

sentences.en: The mistress of the house reluctantly installed the two refugees in a spare room.
sentences.cn: 女主人很不情愿地把两个难民安置在一个空闲的房间里。
他们有些不情愿地拖着脚走着。

sentences.en: We have reluctantly agreed to let him go.
sentences.cn: 我们不情愿地同意放他走。

words.tran_cn: 不情愿的；勉强的；顽抗的
